Dusit Thani Manila Hotel
8.3 Excellent
Based on 5595 reviews

Chose Dusit Thani as my family was looking for a quick fix as we arrived in makati too early and needed a nice place to stay for the day.

We chose Duist Thani primarily because of its proximity to Glorietta and SM and because it was priced lower than usual. Unfortunately, the lower than usual price was due to their ongoing renovations which began as early as 8am and went about the whole day. There is no doubt that Dusit Thani is a 5-star hotel and will be great to stay in, however, I believe Agoda should be a little more open with it's customers, if there is ongoing renovations that could affect the serenity or expected silence associated with 5-star hotels. Our room was an older room, that is spacious, but definitely showing it's age. We like the large bed and bath tub, which is expected in a 5-star hotel. We will definitely check it out again when the renovations are done. If staying here during the renovations, be sure to get rooms that are not directly affected by the banging and clanging, especially if you plan on sleeping in or enjoying the room during the day. having said that, after politely raising the concern to the front desk, they were kind enough to extend our check out and inform the people working directly above us. No real concern, just unfortunate timing for us.

Show more
Timothy , Philippines
Solaire Resort & Casino
8.7 Excellent
Based on 1605 reviews

My complaint is for the absence of an electrical outlet for my hairdryer, the light switches are very confusing, when I needed light, it's like a HIT or MISS, the light came on but it's not the light I needed.

I and my friend are happy that Filipino menu is included in a Chinese name Resto.i repeat AGAIN as I suggestion for REWARDS is it possible for the casino to at least place those gifts/ items being given to us in a BAG or if it's a bigger to tie it with string. It's so Cumbersome carrying it around while in the casino floor playing .i am from out of the country and I am used getting rewards / gifts from d casinos with already tied or placed in a bag. It's a turn Off for me playing and lagging those gifts.still Solaire is my favorite casino among all the casinos. It's a yearly Mecca for me while here in the country for my winter retreat.

Show more
CARMELITA , United States
Belmont Hotel Manila
8.4 Excellent
Based on 1481 reviews

I chose this hotel d/t a long layover. They have a shuttle pick up, which after the international arrival is across the street in a frosted glass lounge with a title Resorts World in red & it's to the left.

I had no idea about this and asked around. I think they have pickups in intervals and you can wait in the lounge. I arrived to the hotel early & had to wait a couple hours but the staff were very nice and offered water and gave me a hotel tour. The hotel is nice and clean and the pool was nice. Although at the time I arrived, there seem to be a lot of people & their facilities are sort of small & filled up quickly. Also I would like to add that in my room there was a door connecting two rooms. At first i thought the door led to a closet & when i opened it it was another room. It looked like the room was occupied but at the time i opened it no one was inside.I think i was able to lock it somehow but I'm not entirely sure. But I think i heard someone try to open the door at one point but it was locked, & i wasnt sure if it was that door or the main door. They have these doors in hotels in the US too but I just thought it was weird i was able to open it. There are restos nearby and a Lawsons. I also took the shuttle in the morning back to the airport but keep in mind they stop by all the other resorts world hotels which makes it a little time consuming. The shuttles come every 45min passed the hour. I was also informed there is an air conditioned walkway to the airport if you like the option, however I have not ever used it before. I paid about $80 for the superior queen room w/ no breakfast included. I chose this hotel d/t it's location and shuttle service. I would recommend this if you like the resto availability, also near a mall, hotel resto, & shuttle/walkway availability. However, overall I would not stay again d/t the price.

Show more
Scarlett , United States
F1 Hotel Manila
7.9 Very good
Based on 3622 reviews

Have actually checked in here quite a number of times as its one the hotels closest to my regional office.

The Good: 1) Prime location 2) 24hr Macdonald's and Pizza Hut 5 mins walking distance away. The Bad: 1) The entrance to the hotel is in some weird corner. 2) Be prepared for a really small TV and bad signal. 3) The king sized bed is actually 2 single beds joined together. You can feel something very rough and hard in the middle, i'm guessing its something they used to bind the beds together. 4) The air-conditioning makes weird noises. 5) Shower facilities are horrible. 6) The lifts take super long to reach you. I once had to wait 15mins for a lift from the 6th floor to ground floor. no joke! 7) The food offered by room service is very limited. 8) Toilet only has 1 roll of toilet paper and no spare. Called room service for another one which came >30 mins later. I think Seda hotel is a little more expensive but a better option overall.

Show more
Kandeepan , Singapore
Edsa Shangri-La Manila
8.6 Excellent
Based on 1038 reviews

I am the daughter. My parents celebrated their anniversary spending 2 days and 1 night at EDSA Shangri-La.

I was the one who personally chose this hotel because I'm very confident that being one of the well know hotels in the country surely my parents will be taken cared off. But to my disappointment, NO. Me and my sister was already coordinating the said booking right after it was booked in Agoda. Everything was running smoothly and even car service was arranged. We went to EDSA Shangri-La to settle the booking and to our surprise, they told us that there was no booking. Talks here and there until after two to three hours finally they were able to traced the booking. The question is, how on earth we were able to coordinate with this establishment so smoothly thru email and have encountered problems when we went there personally. At the time of checking-in, again problem arises. No confirmed car service well in fact from day number one it was there in the booking, fully paid. There was no hair dryer in the room. At the time of check-out still the receptionist was asking for the payment of the car service, well in fact it is paid already. They have given so much hustles to my parents considering that everything was properly coordinated and paid even before the time of checking in. Such a big disappointment.

Show more
Ruth , Philippines
City Garden Grand Hotel
8.5 Excellent
Based on 1852 reviews

Booked a room with 2 beds for 3 adults and 2 children. Had to book an extra bed becaise of the hotels bed limitations.

Upon arrival we didnt get the extra bed until after asking 3 times, 5 hours later, at midnight. We booled with brealfast included, however the hotel claimed that we had to pay for 1 breakfast even though i shpwed ghe booking confirmation stating that it was included. How cheap! Where is the hotels goodwill? How much do it cost them for 1 child breakfast? 20php? Also had a dead cockroach in the bathroom, so obviously no one checked the room before our arrival and its been empty for awhile. Management did nothing to please us and even after our stay we got an email from the management stating the "Oh we check this and that all the time and you are wrong, according to our records you lie. And fauls claims about offering another room..and this and that" It was more of a complaint email than a remedy-email. Very poor management amd unprofessional staff for a 4 star hotel. Shame! I was asked to email management before next stay to get an discount. Buy we will never come back. Your loss!

Show more
Michael , Sweden
Conrad Manila
8.8 Excellent
Based on 486 reviews

We stayed on the 6th floor which has the best sunset view and pool view (though we can't see the fireworks from MOA).

The two double beds were big enough for one adult and one kid each bed. We had two children with us. A third adult could also fit in and sleep on the long sofa along the window. There's an extra blanket but no extra pillow provided. The bathroom is separate from the toilet which is a PRO for us, but our room has no bathtub. I mean, this is a five-star hotel right? A bathtub is a must. Good thing the swimming pool is not a disappointment. The kids had a really good time. The temperature and height of the water was just right for both the kiddie and adult areas. Best time to swim is on early morning. But the CONS are: (1) we were charged for making an outside domestic call. It's so petty of them, it's not even an international call. (2) WiFi is not free on all rooms, just in the check-in lobby. (3) no free coffee. everything must be bought. No near convenience stores, you have to cross to go to MOA. (4) outside food are not allowed in the pool area. (5) cable tv does not include Disney Jr nor Nick Jr. But overall, we had a great staycation in the metro. we would definitely come back. All thanks to their pool.

Show more
Princess , Philippines
Shangri-La at the Fort Manila
9.1 Exceptional
Based on 212 reviews

Upon checking in the front desk officer that time (Angel) ask for identification to process the check in.

Unfortunately I forgot to bring one but I have the credit card I used for the booking with my name on it. She insisted that I should produce the identification for them to process our check in. It became too inconvenient for us especially I'm with my kids and we just wanted to have a worthwhile time at their hotel. Not to mention it was my birthday celebration as well. Everything was ruined that I say I won't recommend the hotel to my friends. I've been to many different five star hotels and this was my first time to be dealt with such inconvenience.

Show more
Eridel , Philippines
Sofitel Philippine Plaza Manila
8.3 Excellent
Based on 3097 reviews

Hotel lobby smells like cockroaches. Grumpy staff. Makes you pay for everything: a bucket of ice for over $2, each utensil at $1.

Key cards are automatically deactivated the next day though reservation is for 2 days. The staff won't tell you this. Ushers at buffet were discourteous. The pool is overcrowded as it is too small for such a hotel. We could hear traffic in our room at the 9th floor. When you close the balcony door, there would be noise like cars racing. We found out it was the wind tunneling through a gap in the door. The bedding were stained. Although the rooms (I booked 2 rooms for 2 nights) were for 2 people, the provision for toiletries and bathrobe were for 1 person. All staff I dealt with didn't know how to listen. They wouldn't get my requests correctly, forgetting items even after repeated statements. This is the worst hotel, considering the price I paid and their marketing slant. It's like paying for a 5 star treatment but getting a cheap hostel experience.

Show more
Janice , Philippines
Makati Diamond Residences
9 Excellent
Based on 1203 reviews

We had high expectations for this hotel, given it's Excellent 9.0 rating here in Agoda and also since it's fairly new (only 2 years old).

But when we arrived the room felt a bit cold in a way that it was bare, it could have used some warmth if they added touches of well-thought out decor. It felt too fuctional or utilitarian, maybe coz it can be considered as a business hotel being at the heart of Makati CBD. We were suprised to find that the bath toiletries (shampoo & shower gel) were mass-produced brands you can buy at a local grocery store. Definitely a first in all of the hotels we've stayed at, both local & international - even small boutique hotels have custom bath amenties just for the hotel. There seems to be a disconnect, like they didn't put much thought or care into these little details. Also, the advertised free mini bar is comprised of just a couple of local beers & snacks. Nothing too exciting really. The staff were quite welcoming, though, and thoughtful - they prepared balloons & a slice of cake for my husband since we were having a staycation for Father's Day weekend. Breakfast was ok, nothing stellar or exceptional - first time we've had a buffet with no rice in a Philippine hotel actually. An added perk is the daily complimentary coffee from their cafe at the lobby, which we appreciated.

Show more
Bernadette , Philippines
I'M Hotel
8.6 Excellent
Based on 375 reviews

The sign that our stay was not going to be a good experience was already there from the day of our check in (this is going to be a long review as I take you step by step on how the hotel repeatedly gave us reasons not to stay here again) My sister and mom arrived at Manila before me so they went on ahead to check in first, my sister called me to inform that there was some problem with the room that we booked, apparently the previous guest did not want to leave and it was already past our check in time.

So, I spoke on the phone to the lady in the front counter who was assisting my family. She explained the situation to me that they can't seem to get the previous guest to leave the room and they only have that one type of room left. Although that's not really a predicament that I should be in because the hotel had ample of time to get the room ready since my family only arrived after 3pm and as I understood the check out time was at 12pm so as I said ample of time. However, I let that slide because the lady was really polite on the phone and she said she will have a lower room for my family to check in first while they wait to get the previous guest out of our originally booked room. Two and a half hours later when my friend and I arrived at the hotel, our original room was still not ready and I spoke to Myra, the one I spoke to on the phone. Dead tired from our journey with our room still not ready, the only reason I still did not make a fuss was because Myra was just a nice to talk too, she was really helpful and accommodating so therefore no fuss was made :) However, when our room was finally ready, the moment we entered there was a really bad stench. A pungent type of smell like cigarette smoke mixed with God knows what. And the smell was really poignant to our nose specially since most of us had sinuses! The gentleman that helped us with our luggage smelled it too and he agreed that the smell was painful to the nose as he too has sinus ( I shall not name him b

Show more
Judie , Malaysia
Makati Shangri-La Manila Hotel
8.9 Excellent
Based on 783 reviews

Overall, the look and feel of this hotel has not changed over the decades. However, in my most recent stay, there were significant details I observed which may indicate that it is already past its prime and needs to go back to its old glory days and meticulous standards.

First, the staff and attendants are generally very friendly and personable. Everyone from the concierge to the housekeeper always express a warm attitude matching their smiles. However, when you meet the attendants on a late part of their shift their stress becomes evident. When I checked in in my most recent stay, the receptionist seemed to be like in the last hours of his shift since he looked tired and only wanted to finish my booking. I had concerns about my room arrangement and reservations, but he never offered any alternative solution nor suggested to confer with his superior. Although the matter was no big issue on my part, I left the front desk thinking that he could have at least taken a few more minutes to try to exhaust other ways to resolve my query. The same also goes for their lobby lounge when I observed there was only one waitress running between 10+ tables attending to nearly 40 persons, including myself. As for the in-room dining, the food served in my room was not of the same quality as what they have in their restaurants. I had small issues with being served dry, old chicken meat and manhandled pasta, but at least they were still edible, although not even three-star quality.

Show more
Bryant , Philippines
Hyatt City of Dreams Manila
8.6 Excellent
Based on 947 reviews

Me and my girl was sitting at the beautiful classy center bar area inside the casino and there's this American guy trying to flirt with her.

She just laughed at him and he took it like it seems she is interested. I just stared at him with a mean look, but he wouldnt stop looking back at us. We left and decided to play the slots. I must have lost all my luck that night, I lost my money on slots. I look back, the creepy bald American guy was lurking behind us and stopped 10 yards away and watched us from the distance. We sped walked out of the casino, notified one of the staff. I pointed at the stalker and told the staff, that guy is following us. The staff member told us "sir, im not part of security, you are talking to the wrong person then he walked away. The old bald creepy guy started walking towards us and me and my girl ran out the casino to try to get away from him. Food is great tho.

Show more
Hiro , United States
St Giles Makati – A St Giles Hotel, Manila
7.6 Very good
Based on 3240 reviews

The buffet breakfast (which is not cheap) is disappointing. There is no healthy bread option, just white bread.

There is no grilled/fried bacon, no cooked tomatoes or mushrooms. The egg station - the staff don't understand 'over easy eggs'. The buffet selections get low or out of food and no-one seems to refill them unless you ask. There are young girl staff (OJT? Unpaid?) who look clueless to help although they smile and appear to want to help. The rooms are tired, old carpet with a feeling and appearance of needing industrial cleaning. The bathroom is the same. The WIFI on arrival did not work at all. Had to call down to lobby twice to get a staff member to turn up with a room router (?) and the WIFI was then good. The staff know the WIFI is weak without these gadgets but again the staff seem clueless to fix the problem long term. I get the feeling that the staff know a major refit/refurbishment/upgrade is badly needed but the owners are unwilling or unable to do what is badly needed. There are better choices for the price (I paid 3500 Php a night with Agoda). BTW I made an error in booking another hotel (totally my fault) and AGODA are refunding all...good customer service AGODA.

Show more
John , United Kingdom
Golden Phoenix Hotel Manila
7.9 Very good
Based on 1923 reviews

We were here for an event at SMX and while it was roughly about 15 minutes walk, the area is rather poorly lit at night which made it unsafe.

Rude taxi drivers didn't help our cause as well. The rooms were OK, but the sheets were not replaced daily and it has not been cleaned/washed for a long time. The toilet sink clogged frequently and it was tiny toilet that had very little standing room. Besides the usual bath towel and toilet rolls, the hotel provided little to no other amenities so i had to call housekeeping more than once to request for hairdryer, bath mats, hand towels, tissue paper and even the "Do Not Disturb" sign. The hotel doors did not have a latch so basically if we slept it, we could have been rudely disturbed by housekeeping (though that did not happen). Our room faced the dumpster which i didn't mind and kept my curtains closed, but the toilet had a stench from the drainage that refused to go away even after we left the ventilation fans on overnight. It was an OK experience as the staff were all very nice and polite but I don't think it was worth the money.

Show more
PANG , Malaysia
Manila Pavilion Hotel & Casino
7.1 Very good
Based on 3472 reviews

Paid for 4 star...was lucky to get a 3. We must of booked on an old website as this place needs to have a lot of money spent to get it to that standard.

The only 2 things that kept us there was the food and the staff and their service to the guest however they lack leadership and need more training when interacting with foreign guests...as for the room we booked in at the 2pm book in time and only 1 of the 2 rooms booked was ready, when we finally got to the room the bed sheets had not been changed as there was dirt and hair from he previous guests and the sheets were ripped and had been previously repaired in other parts. The facebook site for the hotel was out of date and said that " Come March 2013 ,the hotel is set to redefine grandeur as it reveals the completion of its highly prized renovation project....sorry but the project must of been cancelled or in another hotel. The pool and gym was a disgrace and looks like something that was last fixed back in the 80`s, was looking forward to having a swim on a hot day but did not take the chance as we didn`t want to catch anything. My wife and I visit the Philippines every year and as a minimum we book 4 star with pool and breakfast and paid $700 au for 2 rooms for 2 nights and what we got was well below par, we could of had the same at the newer hotels at City of Dreams for the same money. We wont be back.

Show more
DAVID , Australia
Red Planet Makati
7.6 Very good
Based on 6545 reviews

I booked a few rooms at this hotel for my relatives who are arriving from Pangasinan. They had kids ranging from 8 to 14.

Firstly, I'd like to say is that this hotel is not a great place for a family with kids to stay in. Pasay’s Starlight BnB is an attractive property on a side street in ordinary, somewhat gritty area of Manila.

Being in 15-25 minutes of the international airport is its biggest advantage. I felt safe and comfortable walking around the area. While there are no tourist restaurants in the area, there are many typical eating places and 7-11 type stores within one or two blocks. There is suppose to be a large mall nearby, but I never explored that option. The hotel staff was very accommodating. A couple of times they arranged fixed rate taxis for me. While their normal breakfast hours are 7-10 AM, they prepared my breakfast at 6 AM when I needed to leave for an early flight. Cozy seems to be the favorite term to describe the rooms. The hotel and the rooms are what I call Japanese modern: Clean, attractive, efficient use of space, but no mats. The bed was comfortable, the AC worked well, TV had international channels, nice balcony, and the bathroom was small, but certainly not cramped. I plan to stay in Starlight when I return to Manila.

Bottom line is Makati Riverside Inn is a very good value, especially for the adventurous traveler willing to explore and walk a bit. I'm staying here again on my return through MNL on my way out of PH. BTW, there is no food at the property. Agoda forces a response for food, so just ignore that score.

The sink also never clean. no hot/cold shower. but what i'm really disappointed is the aircon. who got the idea to place it behind the curtain. the air can't go out so the whole room is not getting any cool. if you open the curtain, people from outside can watch you how you sleep. no privacy. relocate your aircon. its look like i rent a room with a fan only. actually no fan at all. i will not rent in your place if its not only near the airport coz i'm having a very early flight. hope you do changes here. coz the location is very near to airports. thanks

Annbjorg , Philippines
Alcoves Apartments - Legaspi
8.4 Excellent
Based on 42 reviews

Compliment to the staff! Easy to contact, easy to receive answers in a fast way. Who travel, expecially with small children, appreciate this.

The apartment is good enough for 5/6 people. Kitchen is wide and all you need for preparing food is there. May be it coule be better to check quantities of plates, glasses, forks, spoons and cups becuase 4 of each there are but if you need more it is a little problem. There are rooms, in one a bed with two places and in the other with 3 places )bunk bed). A sofa can be used as a bed if necesary. TV with large screen, cable TV and wifi connection.A little bathroom with shower. The apartment has linen, towels and soap so in case you don't have yours, you can also use them. It is clean but some little ants are in the bathroom (and the floor is 18). Location is fantastic, few minutes walk from Greenbelt shops, Landmark and Glorieta mall. It is also available a pick up and drop off service from/to NAIA. Our stay there was short but absolutely without any trouble.For sure in my future Manila visites, I will stay in an Alcoves apartment.

One Palmtree Villas
7.8 Very good
Based on 122 reviews

I've stayed at 4-5 hotels right by the airport, always just an overnight, and back to the airport in the morning for my next flight.

This is not a hotel room, but more of a condo rental. There is no staff, per se. So you better be clear on who is going to let you into your room. I stayed here for both ends of my trip-coming into and leaving the Philippines. Two different condo. First stay was perfect! Got there, security guard called the care taker who came down in a few minutes and took me to my room Second stay was more complicated. Security guard had "no load" on his phone, so he couldnt call and didn't really care that I was kind of stuck. (I don't have a Filipino cell phone.) I had to ask a condo owner who was walking by if they could help me. Took about an hour to get to my room. Both times the room itself was great. Clean, good AC, nice bathroom, etc. First room had awesome wifi, second room had none! That is a real problem for me, when it was promised as part of the deal. Owner hadn't paid bill, I guess. On the whole, I highly recommend these villas. They are nicer than some hotels in the area who charge more than twice what these cost. But if you need staffing service, these are not for you.

Geoffrey , United States
Avant Apartments At The Fort By Jazz
8.4 Excellent
Based on 19 reviews

We booked several apartments with Avant Apartments At The Fort By Jazz for our Christmas staff reward and were very impressed with each of them.

Each unit is fully loaded with everything you need and has lots of extras you dont see elsewhere such as plenty of towels, big bottles of shampoo and toiletries, washing machine powder, fully equiped kitchen, some even had 3D TV and Dyson fans to go with the air-con. We like the fact that what we saw in the photos is what we got unlike other places which have glossy photos but fail to mention that they are next to a night club or a building site. Here you get views of the golf course from all rooms and the road is closed on the weekend so no traffic noise. It was good value for money as they do not have a service charge. We had an in-room massage for a fraction of the price we have been charged by other hotels in BGC. You can also save on meals and eat out as the immediate area has lots of bars, cafes and restaurants to choose from. There is also a 7-11, 24/7 Macdonalds across the road. We had no problem getting a taxi to the airport and casinos.

In booking, one will always rely to the ad posted. In my case theres no mention of pets allowed/parking space in my end (as I have screen captured the ad) .

I tried calling the number on the property contact number but was out of reach. So I took the chance to bring my dog along. To my dismay pets are not allowed. I asked the doorman if I can talk to the property owner or someone since my dog is inside the cage, the concierge without even asking me immediately dismissed and shooed me away. I have no problem with authorities or the policy but this guy had the poorest of the poor quality of customer service. To cut the story short, i have to go back home and leave the dog. Kathryn , Philippines
Bryan Condominium Suites
7.8 Very good
Based on 105 reviews

As I read on other reviews, the outside of the place i a kinda shabby looking building, but once you are inside it transforms itself into a wonderful surprise.

The rooms are on the 5th floor and it was a pleasant surprise to have a lift that goes up there. I had alot of luggage and was made so much easier by the eager guard and the cooks who are multi task, baggage helpers, domestic cleaners. Once the door of the room was opened, I was well pleased. excellent room! Mine was only standard but still great value. having had so many frustrating showers in S E Asia it is always a delight to get the sort of shower which this place has. You just do not want to get out of it!!! THis place can be hard to find though, depending on the listening ability of the taxi driver. manila taxi drivers are notoriously idiotic when a foreign person jumps inside. All too many start to think is how much I screw this foreigner for. I have had some great ones also but unfortunetly this seems to be the norm in Manila these days. That aside the only problem is that early in the morning it is hard getting a taxi in this location. However the lady at reception is happy to get a taxi to the door via and app. I am not used to this kind of way, being an old timer! Around the corner 3 minutes walk away there is a small mall CASH and CARRY where you can always pick up a taxi, once the mall opens. This mall also has some useful places to eat where foreigners can eat without suffering the local shocking slop! You are also close to all the big malls of makati only a short ride away and withing 10-15 minutes from the airport... of course with the roadwork around the airport can make this trip stretch out to... how long is a piece of string. Getting to the business area of makati is walkable... well for me it is, so location is ideal. I would stay here again for sure when/if I come back to manila.

More about Manila

The capital of the Philippines, Manila is one of the busiest and most densely populated cities in South East Asia. The city is served by Ninoy Aquino International Airport, and travelers have a wide range of accommodations from which to choose with many options available near the airport, Pasay, and Manila Bay.

The commercial center of the city is Makati, where a wide array of restaurants and bars cater to practically any taste and offer everything from Chinese cuisine to American cheeseburgers. In the middle of the chaotic city are many parks to provide a respite to locals and travelers, with Rizal Park being the most iconic.

Another popular attraction in Manila is the 18th-century Fort Santiago in Intramuros, which was once a prison but has since been transformed into a park.

Commonly considered one of the better amusement parks in Manila, Enchanted Kingdom is perhaps the most popular destination for young adventurers. Separated into themed areas, the park features a great many rides, including one of the tallest rollercoasters in the world. With many exciting attractions, culture, and historic architecture, Manila is definitely a destination not to be missed.

Mesa 12 hotels Valenzuela 12 hotels Find the Perfect Type of Accommodation Apartments in Manila 2190 Serviced Apartments in Manila 161 Hostels in Manila 77 Guest Houses in Manila 52 Motels in Manila 19 Resorts in Manila 10 Capsule Hotels in Manila 3 Love Hotels in Manila 2 Bungalows in Manila 1 More about Manila The capital of the Philippines, Manila is one of the busiest and most densely populated cities in South East Asia. The city is served by Ninoy Aquino International Airport , and travelers have a wide range of accommodations from which to choose with many options available near the airport, Pasay, and Manila Bay. The commercial center of the city is Makati , where a wide array of restaurants and bars cater to practically any taste and offer everything from Chinese cuisine to American cheeseburgers. In the middle of the chaotic city are many parks to provide a respite to locals and travelers, with Rizal Park being the most iconic. Another popular attraction in Manila is the 18th-century Fort Santiago in Intramuros, which was once a prison but has since been transformed into a park. Commonly considered one of the better amusement parks in Manila, Enchanted Kingdom is perhaps the most popular destination for young adventurers. Separated into themed areas, the park features a great many rides, including one of the tallest rollercoasters in the world. With many exciting attractions, culture, and historic architecture, Manila is definitely a destination not to be missed.
